column4: Did you take the CD out when you rebooted?  What did you do after it rebooted?
i didn't have a cd inserted, the instal cd was mounted
when it rebooted i waited for it to boot back up again..
Mounted within windows?  So there was no physical CD involved at all?
correct
Wubi wont touch your bootloader at all, it simply adds an entry into the boot.ini for windows
so how can it have written to boot.ini if it didn't realise i have a raid array? :S
because boot.ini is just a file, and it can write to it just like you write to any file in windows
I don't see any reason why it would have touched your RAID array, no.
that's a bootable cd? hopefully it
that's a bootable cd? hopefully it's not large, slow internet here
What's a bootable CD?
a live cd? something i can boot from - i have no dos / shell
Yeah. A liveCD is a bootable CD.  But you may be meaning to talk to stefg
appologies
so you dont know what could have caused the raid array to fail? any guesses?
No idea
are you still here? I removed my new 1tb hdd and plugged in my cd drive (removed the cd drive as i didnt have enough power cables on my psu) and now vista/ubuntu boot fine - i dont understand
it wasnt the fault of the 1tb drive because i know it works fine, been using it
It could be a power supply issue?  I don't know.  Or it could be that your drive numbers got changed, and that messed up windows

must be yes, i'll remove that forum post,,,, hopefully if i remove wubi via the windows uninstaller and stick my 1tb drive back in, it'll all work ok again. i still intend on installing ubuntu (properly) next week so it can be on both desktop and laptop
thanks for the help, strange errors like this confuse me!
